data: `minecraft:behavior.nearest_prioritized_attackable_target` allows an entity to target and prioritize the nearest valid target.

data.Name: attack_interval
data.Description: Time in seconds before selecting a target

data.Name: [entity_types](../Definitions/NestedTables/entity_types.md)
data.Description: List of entity types that this mob considers valid targets

data.Name: must_reach
data.Description: If true, only entities that this mob can path to can be selected as targets

data.Name: must_see
data.Description: If true, only entities in this mob's viewing range can be selected as targets

data.Name: must_see_forget_duration
data.Description: Determines the amount of time in seconds that this mob will look for a target before forgetting about it and looking for a new one when the target isn't visible any more

data.Name: persist_time
data.Description: Time in seconds for a valid target to stay targeted when it becomes and invalid target.

data.Name: priority
data.Description: Specifies the priority in which filtered enemy types should be attacked. Lower number means higher priority.

data.Name: reselect_targets
data.Description: If true, the target will change to the current closest entity whenever a different entity is closer

data.Name: scan_interval
data.Description: How many ticks to wait between scanning for a target.

data.Name: set_persistent
data.Description: Allows the actor to be set to persist upon targeting a player

data.Name: target_search_height
data.Description: Height in blocks to search for a target mob. -1.0 means the height does not matter.

data.Name: within_radius
data.Description: Distance in blocks that the target can be within to launch an attack
